items.title: Live: 'I am the president': Deposed Venezuelan leader Maduro, wife enter pleas in New York
items.description: Nicolás Maduro and his wife face court in New York for the first time since being captured by US forces, as an emergency meeting of the UN Security Council gets underway. Follow live.

items.title: Trump move on Greenland would mean end of NATO, says Danish leader
items.description: Military intervention in Venezuela has reignited fears about US President Donald Trump's designs on the autonomous Danish territory.

items.title: How Trump's oil grab could up-end the global financial system
items.description: In a world awash with oil, US President Donald Trump's takeover of Venezuela seems to be more about power than production.

items.title: Maduro tells judge he has been 'kidnapped'
items.description: Nicolás Maduro and Cilia Flores, who were captured in Caracas at the weekend, face multiple drugs and weapons charges.

items.title: Trump's bombs were as much an attack on China as they were on Venezuela
items.description: Venezuela has spent years getting cosier with China. Now Donald Trump is sending a clear warning to Beijing — get out of his backyard.

items.title: Live: Travis Head nearing another Ashes ton to start day three at SCG
items.description: Australia is in a strong position to start day three of the fifth and final Ashes Test at the SCG, with Travis Head nearing his third century of the series. Follow live.

items.title: Live: ASX set to rise as oil price jumps after strike on Venezuela
items.description: Australian shares are set to jump as the price of oil makes a comeback. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: Djokovic withdraws from Australian Open lead-up event in Adelaide
items.description: With the Australian Open on the horizon, Novak Djokovic does not feel he is well enough prepared to contest next week's Adelaide International.

items.title: LA-like fires could hit Australian capital cities, report warns
items.description: Australia's capital cities are increasingly at risk of being affected by a major fire like the one that ravaged Los Angeles last year, according to a new climate report.

items.title: Bruce Lehrmann launches High Court appeal in latest defamation battle round
items.description: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann takes his appeal to the High Court against the findings that he, on the balance of probabilities, raped Brittany Higgins in 2019.

items.title: Prominent Labor figures join calls for antisemitism royal commission
items.description: A group of former Labor MPs, senators and party officials have signed an open letter asking Anthony Albanese to call a national royal commission into the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Banyule locals blame North East Link for sinkhole at football oval
items.description: A sinkhole has opened up in Banyule Flats Reserve, close to where a North East Link tunnel boring machine is operating.

items.title: Teenage girl sexually assaulted and pregnant while in state care
items.description: Child safety experts say the case of a 13-year-old girl who became pregnant while in state care highlights the dangers of the residential system.

items.title: Paris court finds 10 people guilty of cyberbullying Brigitte Macron
items.description: Several defendants told the court their comments were intended as humour or satire.

items.title: Man walks 40 kilometres after getting bogged amid outback floods
items.description: A traveller is in hospital after walking through knee-deep mud after he became bogged in outback Queensland on Saturday.

items.title: Serial fraudster allegedly targeting pet and home owners in scam
items.description: Dozens of people from multiple states have come forward after allegedly falling victim to a new pet and house-sitting scam orchestrated by career con artist Patricia McIntyre.

items.title: How a sour rivalry thrust figure skating into the realm of soap opera
items.description: The genteel and sequined world of figure skating had its dark side exposed in a drama worthy of a soap opera in 1994, as Nancy Kerrigan was the victim of a dastardly plot to eliminate her from the Winter Olympics.

items.title: Rebel tree planters' work removed after beachfront poisonings
items.description: A Queensland council is being criticised for uprooting unauthorised saplings from sand dunes amid a long-running vegetation battle.

items.title: Lifesavers say 'swim between flags' message not enough after drownings
items.description: Surf lifesavers are rethinking their iconic beach safety message after multiple drownings at remote or unpatrolled swim spots in NSW.

items.title: How a 'ruthless' energy company went after a pensioner for money he didn't owe
items.description: Australia's energy prices continue to soar as questions continue to be raised about the actions of providers, including by this pensioner who was overcharged and then had debt collectors chasing him.

items.title: Tasmania's bioluminescence unrelated to salmon farm nutrients, scientist says
items.description: Scientists say a bioluminescent algae causes the red tides at the centre of recent environmentalist concerns — but that's not to say the magnificent display is totally harmless to marine life.

items.title: Algae fears boost business in unaffected SA tourist towns
items.description: An algal bloom that has been ravaging parts of SA's coast for months is pushing visitors to head to other parts of the state.

items.title: Here's what to expect from the RBA this year with rate hikes on the table
items.description: Mortgage borrowers and savers may have used the new year as an excuse to get their financial affairs in order, but things may be set to change within a matter of months.

items.title: Prison escapee attacks Victorian farm worker
items.description: A farm worker says he was threatened by a man who escaped from Langi Kal Kal prison near Ballarat.

items.title: Insurance, Centrelink repayments 'final nail in coffin' for abuse survivors
items.description: When survivors of child sexual abuse receive compensation, many may have to repay Centrelink, Medicare and private health insurance amounts relating to their abuse.
